text: hey guys it's at least welcome back to
my cupcake addiction where today I'm
going to be showing you some sprinkle
hacks so I'm going to be showing you
some really kind of fun interesting and
unique ingredients that you can use to
make your own sprinkles
you know I love saving you guys money
and coming up with really cool and
unique ways to decorate your cakes and
cupcakes these are going to be a few the
first Reese's peanut butter cups now
these little guys are unassuming I know
we bake them into cupcakes but did you
know that when you chop them they kind
of crumble a little bit in the middle
chop them up really really nice and
finely and you can use them just
sprinkle right on top of your cupcakes
or even press up against the side walls
of your cakes to give it kind of like a
peanut butter cup coating Skittles did
you know you can make sprinkles out of
skittles and they taste just like
skittles the basic premise is you pass
the skittles into either a blender or a
food processor make sure it's a pretty
high-powered one and pulverize them pop
them into a really really low oven the
lowest oven setting temperature that
you've got and let them dry out for an
hour or two until they're really really
nice and crisp and then pass them
through the middle of a sieve just to
get rid of any of those little kind of
sticky bits on the inside pop them into
a ziploc bag they are ready to go you
can store them for up to a month and
you've got skittles sprinkles M&Ms
everybody thinks about topping their
cupcakes with M&Ms but nobody thinks
about sticking them into a ziplock bag
and pulverizing them a couple of good
sharp hard whacks in that ziplock bag
and what you're going to end up with is
sprinkles or colors like chocolate
sprinkles but then there's all these
little flecks of rainbow color so with
minis do it with maxi's do it with
peanut whatever your favorite M&M is
boiled lollies so these guys your little
boiled candy sweets when you smash these
up you've got a whole rainbow of colors
and they taste amazing make sure you
smash them quite small because you want
to make sure that you're not leaving
huge big chunks of boiled lollies
because they're pretty hard to bite down
on coconut now coconut is sometimes a
deal breaker and I know some of you guys
are going to hate it
and some of you guys are going to love
it but did you know that when you place
it into a ziploc bag with a couple of
drops of just a regular liquid food
coloring shake and shake and shake and
shake and shake and shake once you've
shaken all that color through you can
place it on some parchment paper or
baking paper let it completely dry out
and you've got yourself some colored any
color you want
coconut sprinkles these guys here are
called florists so I don't really know
what they're called in different places
around the world but they're these
little tiny candies and they're really
popular in most countries pop them into
a ziplock bag
smash them up and you can go as fine or
as coarse as you like here doesn't
really matter it just depends if you
want to really find sprinkle or if you
want kind of like a chunkier funfetti
looking sprinkle jelly jelly jelly
crystals or whatever you want to call it
we're going to use these in the raw form
so you are not going to make them
according to the manufacturer's
instructions you want to just pour them
out and I use these in my first ever
YouTube video to line the cookie monster
cupcakes so basically you just frost up
your cupcake roll it in those jello
sprinkles and it coats the cupcake in
kind of a bit of a shimmery cover
absolutely beautiful and tastes like
whatever flavor gel are you using so
that's all the sprinkle options that I'm
showing you today and I hope that I've
managed to find a couple that you
haven't seen before if you've got any
